text: Lobor is a city and municipality in the Northern Croatia. In 2011 census, there were 357,652 inhabitants in the area, 98.96% of which were Croats. During the first year of the World War II Ustaše established a concentration camp in Lobor, also known as Loborgrad concentration camp, for Jewish and Serb women and children.: "Loborgrad was specifically designated for Serb and Jewish women and children; At least 200 of them died in it.: "9 August 1941 - a camp was established in Loborgrad for about 1,700 women and children; over 200 people died in the camp," ==References== == Sources == * * * ==External links== * Category:Populated places in Krapina-Zagorje County Category:Municipalities of Croatia
title: Lobor
